page.title: 09FARMING
page.content:
Farms are all family run.
{Terrain:}The high lying land has peat-based topsoil underlaid with boulder clay giving little natural drainage and suitable only for stock rearing.Classified as "Marginal" or "Hill land",it qualifies for subsidies under the EEC Common Agricultural Policy.
{Livestock:}Scottish Blackface or Swaledale ewe crossed with Bluefaced Leicester Ram produces Greyfaced lambs.The ewe lambs are purchased by the lowland farmer for breeding purposes whilst the wedder lambs go for slaughter.Suckler cows are kept and crossed with one of the continental breed bulls _ Charolais,Limousin,Blonde d'Aquitaine or Simmental. {More on P.10 ]]
